creator: corneliu.giurgiu@gmail.com
text:
When running in GUI mode with the "Run Thread Groups consecutively" checked, the thread-groups get executed sequentially in order.

When executing the same JMX file from command line (in my case solaris) this property seems to be ignored, as the thread-groups get executed simultaneously.

I was unable to find a bug on this matter, but I found this old question: http://jmeter.512774.n5.nabble.com/how-to-control-threadgroup-running-mode-via-cmd-line-property-td531708.html

Has anything changed since then?

Created attachment 27770
Sample test case

Try the attached test case on your system, and attach the JTL and LOG files
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
I meant to add - works fine for me, so we'll need a test case that does not work for you.

I've provided a sample; please try it.

If it works for you, then try to find out what is different from your test case.

We'll need a simple test case that shows the problem for you, along with JTL and LOG files. Please use the Java Request sampler if possible, as that does not rely on external access.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
Hi,

I apologise, further tests, including the one you supplied, revealed there was a problem interpreting the results. Somehow the tool groups together all the samples by name, even though the steps where they were launched are different.

Bottom line, this is not a bug.

Kind regards and many thanks,
Cornel
creator: corneliu.giurgiu@gmail.com
